verses.roman:
ei nava prīty-aṅkura yāṅra citte haya
prākṛta-kṣobhe tāṅra kṣobha nāhi haya

synonyms: ei—this; nava—nine; prīti-aṅkura—fructification of the seed of love; yāṅra—of whom; citte—in the mind; haya—there is; prākṛta—material; kṣobhe—in agitation; tāṅra—his; kṣobha—agitation; nāhi haya—there is not.
translation: "If love for Kṛṣṇa in a seedling state has fructified in one's heart, one is not agitated by material things.
